content:
First of all we need you to help us specify the issue.

It's important to find out whether you can access Trezor Wallet (link)

connections.title: I can access Trezor Wallet at wallet.trezor.io but there is an issue
connections.description: Something is wrong with the Trezor Wallet interface, balance is not correct etc.

connections.title: I cannot access the wallet at all
connections.description: Trezor Wallet says "Connect Trezor to continue" or "Loading"

connections.title: I'm facing an issue with 3rd party wallet
Firmware update issue
connections.description: Issues related to firmware update of your Trezor

connections.title: The device is clearly physically broken

text: I'm able to access the wallet but...
content: What type of issue are you facing?

connections.title: The balance is not correct
Unconfirmed transaction
There is an unauthorized transaction that was not made by myself

content: What's Trezor Wallet displaying?

connections.title: Trezor Wallet says "Connect Trezor to continue"
Trezor Wallet says "Loading"
Complete balance is gone
connections.description: There is no transaction history available

connections.title: I can see the balance, but it's not correct
connections.description: The transaction history is available but there is a transaction missing for example

content: Did this issue occured after performing a firmware update?

connections.title: Yes, this happened after firmware update
No, I did not perform firmware recently

content:
Most likely something went wrong during the firmware update and your Trezor got wiped (this is a security feature). However, there is no need to worry, all you need to do now is to run a recovery process using your recovery seed words. Please, follow these instructions - https://wiki.trezor.io/User_manual:Recovery

Once this is done you should be able to access your wallet with all your coins.

connections.title: This did not help, I want to contact Trezor support

content: Do you use passphrase protection? (If you are not sure, learn more about passphrase in our user manual)

connections.title: Yes, I'm using the passphrase protection
No, I'm not using the passphrase protection

content:
It is possible that you did not type the passphrase correctly.


1) Please check all possible variations for the possible mistype (Passphrase length can be 50 characters max, it is case-sensitive and all ASCII characters are count - even empty space is a character)
2) Make sure that you have set the correct keyboard layout
3) When typing the Passphrase please click on "Show passphrase" so you can see what you're actually typing

By "mistyping" the Passphrase you will create a new Passphrase wallet. For example, if you choose Passphrase "sea", this wallet can be accessed only when "sea" is typed in, if you mistype the word and will type for example "see" than you will create a new wallet under Passphrase "see" that is different from the one protected by passphrase "sea" (same with "Sea" or "SEE" etc. - Passphrase is case sensitive).

NOTE: Don't use these words, these are just examples.

connections.title: This did not help, I want to contact Trezor support

content: Is any transaction marked as "uncofirmed" in your transaction history?

connections.title: Yes, there is at least one unconfirmed transaction
No, all transactions are confirmed

content: The bitcoin network might be overwhelmed and it may take quite a significant time for a new transaction to be confirmed, especially if a lower fee was set (it can be hours or even days). At this moment you just need to wait. Your transaction will be either confirmed or returned to your wallet.
Please, clear your browser's cache and refresh the page

connections.title: This did not help, I want to contact Trezor support

content: Is the display lit when the device is plugged in?

connections.title: Yes, the display is lit
No, the display is dead

content:
Please, try clearing your browser's cache and refreshing the page.

Also, if you are using VPN, certain advanced Firewall or Antivirus settings, browser extensions (AdBlock, Privacy Badger etc.) or some cryptocurrencies apps such as Geth or MetaMask for example, try disabling them. It is possible that some of these are clashing with Trezor Wallet.

connections.title: This did not help, I want to contact support

content: Is the device recognized in the device manager of your computer?

connections.title: Yes, the device is recognized by the device manager
No, the device is not recognized by the device manager

text: Problem might be with the drivers
content: Try (re)installing the newest version from this source: https://wallet.trezor.io/#/bridge (once installed, please, proceed with clearing your browser's cache). After successful installation, you should see "trezord" process running in your activity/system/task monitor.

connections.title: Bridge is running and the device is still not recognized by Trezor Wallet

content: Try using different USB cable, USB port and make sure that you are connecting your Trezor with the cable directly, please, omit using any USB hub or adapter. Also, if possible, try connecting your Trezor to another computer.

connections.title: This did not help

text: 3rd party wallet does not work properly
content: Can you access the your 3rd party wallet's account?

connections.title: Yes, I can access my account
connections.description: The problem is with balance, token etc.

connections.title: No, I can't access my account

content: If you can access your account with 3rd party wallet, then the Trezor integration seems to be working and the issue is most likely with the given wallet's interface. Please, contact their support directly with your inquiry.

Can you access Trezor Wallet? 

We need to know whether the issue is with the connection in general or is the issue is related to the given wallet only

connections.title: No, I cannot access Trezor Wallet
Yes, I can access Trezor Wallet without any problem

text: What's the problem with firmware update?

connections.title: I cannot start the firmware update
The whole balance is gone after I've performed the firmware update
Trezor stopped working after the firmware update

text: I cannot initiate the firmware update
content: Please, see our user manual section regarding the firmware update by following this link

connections.title: It's still not working

text: I still cannot initiate the firmware update
content: Is there any error message saying that the USB cannot be recognized properly or that there is a problem with USB drivers?

connections.title: Yes, I can see such error message
No, there is no error message displayed

content:
There is a problem with Windows USB drivers failing to recognize the Trezor in the bootloader mode.

Please, find a manual on how to fix this issue by following this link

connections.title: This did not help
